review.title: Belief Approach for Social Networks
review.abstract: Nowadays, social networks became essential in information exchange between individuals. Indeed, as users of these networks, we can send messages to other people according to the links connecting us. Moreover, given the large volume of exchanged messages, detecting the true nature of the received message becomes a challenge. For this purpose, it is interesting to consider this new tendency with reasoning under uncertainty by using the theory of belief functions. In this paper, we tried to model a social network as being a network of fusion of information and determine the true nature of the received message in a well-defined node by proposing a new model: the belief social network.

sections.text: A social network can be defined as a group of people or organizations that are connected between them through relationships and social exchanges that sustain them. sections.heading: 6 Conclusion
sections.text: In this work, we introduced a general introduction in the first section, in which we reviewed the concept of social networks and the interest of the proposed method to meet the expectations of thinking under uncertainty. In the second section, we briefly introduced the basic concepts used in the theory of faith functions. Then, we focused on the introduction of our model and the different spelling used. In fact, we covered step by step the development of the construction of the graph. Finally, we introduced in detail the process of merging the information flowing through the network. We also showed how the process of merging is carried out and explained how we can make a decision about the type of messages received using pignistic probability. In fact, in many cases, we can make a new decision about the nature of the topic received by a well-defined node. This idea was explained in the second example in the illustration part.
